lines: Mom and Dad have taken the family to the beach. Dad has fallen asleep on the blanket and Mom is body-surfing on the waves. You are playing with a bucket and a shovel.
Dad is extremely difficult to disturb. He is sound asleep and is snoring loudly. You had better try something else.

The mixing is best accomplished when done by hand. You imagine that you are a world-famous chef. First course will be mud soup. This will be followed by mud burgers. For dessert: mud pies. After you are finished you:
Mom is out on the waves hanging ten on a borrowed surfboard. She is not attending to you right now.
Dad is still sleeping, but looks like he might be the perfect "dinner guest." You ask him if he would like to try the mud soup.
#MAKE BELIEVE YOU ARE FEEDING HIM THE MUD SOUP

You carefully dip the shovel into the bucket and remove some mud soup, complete with seashell vegetables. You are going to rub the tiniest little bit of it against his lips, certain that it will not wake him up. At the last moment
#MAKE BELIEVE YOU ARE FEEDING HIM THE MUD SOUP

The shovel is near his lip. Your tiny hand shakes slightly trying to keep even pressure on the shovel. All at once, a rather large mass of water, sand and broken sea shells slips off the shovel and deposits itself directly in Dad's
half-opened mouth. Dad wakes up believing he is about to die.

You occupy yourself for several minutes making believe that Dad is eating the mud soup. Then you realize that the mud burgers and the mud pies are still not "eaten." You fix Dad a nice, juicy mud burger. Perhaps he wouldn't notice it
if you put a very small amount on your finger and put it on his lips.
#GET TIRED AND GO SOMEPLACE ELSE TO PLAY

He noticed! Dad is sticking his tongue in and out of his mouth at about 1,000 miles an hour and saying the "S-word" over and over. Did you do something wrong? Dad screams out your mother's name but cannot find her.
Good choice. Now is not the time to act macho. All is forgiven.
Dad doesn't seem to hear this. He is still busy getting the sand off his tongue.

Chicken! Don't you know most kids your age can get away with murder? Just think of how much fun it would have been to feed Dad the mud burger. On the other hand, he won't have that to remember when you ask to borrow the car later in life.
You think of all the things you could be doing with Dad if he were awake.
You figure out how to turn it on. It is making noises. Perhaps Dad wants to hear some music.

Dad jumps up making snorting sounds with his nose, and crashes into the umbrella, which falls on the lady in back of him. You get startled yourself and keep your distance from the scene. Dad begins to scream. He yells, "DON'T
TOUCH THE RADIO!" He gets over it.
Chicken! Don't you know that kids your age can get away with murder? On the positive side, Dad has a nice relaxing sleep and takes everyone to the movies later in the day. Everyone has fun.
